filmography.title: It Should Happen to You
filmography.role_description: A documentary filmmaker who falls in love with a fame-hungry model, serving as the voice of reason against her pursuit of celebrity.
filmography.plot: A model desperate for fame rents a billboard in Columbus Circle with her name on it, attracting the attention of a soap manufacturer and a documentary filmmaker.

filmography.title: Mister Roberts
filmography.role_description: A lazy, womanizing laundry officer aboard a Navy cargo ship who learns the meaning of courage and leadership.
filmography.plot: In the waning days of World War II, a cargo ship officer battles his tyrannical captain while trying to get a transfer to combat duty.

filmography.title: Operation Mad Ball
filmography.role_description: A manipulative private who organizes a secret fraternization party for soldiers and nurses right under the nose of his strict captain.
filmography.plot: Soldiers stationed in France after WWII scheme to hold a secret dance with the army nurses, trying to outwit their commanding officers.

filmography.title: Bell, Book and Candle
filmography.role_description: A playful warlock and bongo-playing musician who helps his witch sister cast a spell on a publisher.
filmography.plot: A modern-day witch casts a love spell on her neighbor to prevent him from marrying her college rival.

filmography.title: Some Like It Hot
filmography.role_description: A jazz bassist who witnesses a mob hit and disguises himself as a woman to hide in an all-female band, unexpectedly getting engaged to a millionaire.
filmography.plot: Two male musicians witness a mob hit and flee the state in an all-female band disguised as women, but further complications set in.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Actor; BAFTA: Win – Best Foreign Actor

filmography.title: The Apartment
filmography.role_description: A lonely office drone who tries to advance his career by letting company executives use his apartment for extramarital affairs.
filmography.plot: A man tries to rise in his company by letting its executives use his apartment for trysts, but complications and a romance of his own ensue.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Actor; BAFTA: Win – Best Foreign Actor

filmography.title: Days of Wine and Roses
filmography.role_description: A public relations executive who introduces his wife to social drinking, leading both of them into a destructive spiral of alcoholism.
filmography.plot: An alcoholic falls in love with and gets married to a young woman, whom he systematically addicts to booze so they can share his 'passion' together.

filmography.title: Irma la Douce
filmography.role_description: An honest Parisian policeman who falls for a prostitute and creates an alter ego to become her sole client.
filmography.plot: A former policeman falls in love with a prostitute and tries to get her out of the business by paying for her time himself.

filmography.title: Good Neighbor Sam
filmography.role_description: A wholesome advertising executive who agrees to pose as his neighbor's husband to help her inherit a fortune.
filmography.plot: A man agrees to pose as his neighbor's husband to help her claim an inheritance, but the ruse threatens his own marriage and career.

filmography.title: How to Murder Your Wife
filmography.role_description: A successful cartoonist who drunkenly marries a woman at a bachelor party and then fantasizes about killing her in his comic strip.
filmography.plot: A comic strip artist who is opposed to marriage accidentally marries a woman, then executes a murder plot in his comic that the police think is real.

filmography.title: The Great Race
filmography.role_description: A dual role as a dastardly, mustachioed villain and a drunken crown prince in a slapstick race around the world.
filmography.plot: A professional daredevil and a villainous arch-rival race from New York to Paris in the early 20th century.

filmography.title: The Fortune Cookie
filmography.role_description: A TV cameraman who is injured during a football game and is coerced by his shyster brother-in-law to fake a serious injury for insurance money.
filmography.plot: A cameraman is injured at a sporting event, and his lawyer brother-in-law concocts a scheme to exaggerate the injury for a huge settlement.

filmography.title: The Odd Couple
filmography.role_description: A neurotic, neat-freak newswriter who moves in with his sloppy friend after being thrown out by his wife.
filmography.plot: Two friends try sharing an apartment, but their ideas of housekeeping and lifestyles are as different as night and day.

filmography.title: The Out-of-Towners
filmography.role_description: An Ohio executive traveling to New York City for a job interview who encounters an endless series of urban disasters.
filmography.plot: A man and his wife travel to New York City for a job interview and encounter a series of catastrophes that test their sanity.

filmography.title: Avanti!
filmography.role_description: An uptight American executive who travels to Italy to claim his father's body and discovers a long-standing romance.
filmography.plot: A businessman goes to Italy to arrange for the return of his tycoon father's body, only to discover his father died with his mistress.

filmography.title: Save the Tiger
filmography.role_description: A disillusioned garment manufacturer struggling with financial ruin and a midlife crisis over a day and a half in Los Angeles.
filmography.plot: A business executive wrestles with his conscience as he considers arson to save his failing garment company.

filmography.title: The Front Page
filmography.role_description: A star reporter who wants to quit the business to get married but is lured back by his editor for one last big scoop.
filmography.plot: A newspaper editor uses every trick in the book to keep his ace reporter from quitting to get married.

filmography.title: The Prisoner of Second Avenue
filmography.role_description: A Manhattan executive who loses his job and suffers a nervous breakdown during a heatwave, compounded by urban annoyances.
filmography.plot: A married couple living in a high-rise apartment in New York City deals with the husband's job loss and nervous breakdown.

filmography.title: The China Syndrome
filmography.role_description: A dedicated supervisor at a nuclear power plant who discovers a dangerous safety violation and tries to expose the truth.
filmography.plot: A reporter finds what appears to be a cover-up of safety hazards at a nuclear power plant.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Actor; Cannes: Win – Best Actor

filmography.title: Tribute
filmography.role_description: A gregarious but dying Broadway press agent who tries to mend his relationship with his estranged, serious son.
filmography.plot: A Broadway press agent who finds out he is dying tries to reconnect with his estranged son.

filmography.title: Missing
filmography.role_description: A conservative American businessman who travels to Chile to find his missing son, slowly realizing his own government's complicity.
filmography.plot: When an American writer disappears during the Chilean coup, his wife and father try to find him, facing bureaucratic stonewalling.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Actor; Cannes: Win – Best Actor

filmography.title: Dad
filmography.role_description: An elderly man dominated by his wife who rediscovers his independence when his son comes to care for him.
filmography.plot: A busy executive returns home to care for his aging father, helping him regain his spirit and independence.

filmography.title: JFK
filmography.role_description: A private investigator who provides key, albeit unstable, information regarding the conspiracy to assassinate President Kennedy.
filmography.plot: New Orleans District Attorney Jim Garrison discovers there's more to the Kennedy assassination than the official story.

filmography.title: Glengarry Glen Ross
filmography.role_description: A desperate, aging real estate salesman once known as 'The Machine' who resorts to bribery to save his job.
filmography.plot: An examination of the machinations behind the scenes at a real estate office.
filmography.awards: Venice Film Festival: Win – Volpi Cup (Best Actor)

filmography.title: Short Cuts
filmography.role_description: An estranged grandfather who reconnects with his son's family during a hospital crisis in this Robert Altman ensemble piece.
filmography.plot: The day-to-day lives of several suburban Los Angeles residents criss-cross in this ensemble drama based on Raymond Carver stories.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Win – Best Ensemble Cast

filmography.title: Grumpy Old Men
filmography.role_description: A retired history teacher who engages in a lifelong feud with his neighbor, played by Walter Matthau.
filmography.plot: A lifelong feud between two neighbors since childhood only gets worse when a new female neighbor moves across the street.

filmography.title: Hamlet
filmography.role_description: A sentinel at Elsinore castle who is among the first to see the ghost of Hamlet's father.
filmography.plot: Hamlet, Prince of Denmark, returns home to find his father murdered and his mother remarried to the murderer, his uncle.
